intro: Scolobus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are usually palmately lobed or divided. The flowers are typically small and clustered in an umbel, with sepals that are often brightly colored. Scolobus species are found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are often toxic and should be handled with care.
